thread.title: Congress Closer To Lifting Crude Ban, Shale Firms Up
thread.title_full: Congress Closer To Lifting Crude Ban, Shale Firms Up

title: Congress Closer To Lifting Crude Ban, Shale Firms Up
text:
Tesla Started At Outperform; Solar Stocks Are Buys 
Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA) was started with a top rating Wednesday while SolarCity (NASDAQ:SCTY), First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) and other solar companies got bullish ratings. Oppenheimer initiated coverage on Tesla with an outperform rating and 340 price target. Tesla shares closed up 0.3% to 248.91 in ... 09/09/2015 05:06 PM ET How Saudi Arabia Could Still Lose Oil Market Share 
Despite keeping oil production high and prices low to maintain market share, Saudi Arabia could still see its dominance as the world's top crude exporter eroded by competitors as well as its own domestic energy needs. A report out Wednesday from the U.S. Energy Information Administration noted ... 09/09/2015 03:51 PM ET Warren Buffett Sees Bargains, Spends $500 Mil A Week 
Warren Buffett, true to form, was busy buying stocks as the market retreated. He says that Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE:BRKB) has dived deeper into IT giant IBM (NYSE:IBM) this quarter. The investment comes after Berkshire recently ploughed $4.5 billion into oil refining company Phillips 66 (NYSE:PSX) ... 09/08/2015 04:24 PM ET Moving Past Oil, Saudi Arabia Meets With GE, Lockheed 
Saudi Arabia's King Salman's trip to the U.S. included presentations to executives at General Electric (NYSE:GE), Lockheed Martin (NYSE:LMT) and Boeing (NYSE:BA), according to reports, amid a push in the oil-rich country to diversify its economy as oil prices stay lower for longer. Beefing up its ... 09/08/2015 04:14 PM ET After Iran Deal, Will U.S. Lift Oil Embargo On Texas? 
Continental Resources, EOG Resources and other U.S. shale companies that pump oil from areas of Texas and North Dakota dubbed "Cowboyistan" could be among the biggest beneficiaries of the nuclear deal with Iran. While the economic reasons for lifting the export ban on U.S. crude have been well ... 09/02/2015 06:59 PM ET Better For American Express: Sam's Club Or Costco? 
American Express (NYSE:AXP) inked a deal with Sam's Club just months after the credit card company and Costco Wholesale (NASDAQ:COST) went their separate ways. Wal-Mart (NYSE:WMT)-owned Sam's Club, a warehouse membership club, will begin accepting American Express cards starting on Oct. 1 at its ... 01:40 PM ET Lululemon Stock Dives To 8-Month Low On Weak Guidance 
Lululemon Athletica's (NASDAQ:LULU) stock price tanked Thursday after the maker of yogawear and other athletic wear beat quarterly earnings and sales views but offered disappointing guidance. Reporting before the open, Lululemon Athletica posted fiscal second-quarter earnings of 34 cents a share, ... 01:16 PM ET As GE Mulls New HQ, Ex-Im Bank Looms As Leverage 
As General Electric (NYSE:GE) mulls its decision to move its headquarters, the picture may be colored by the political football known as the Export-Import Bank. The federal credit agency, which provides financing for some overseas sales, saw its charter expire on June 30. It has been a lightning ... 01:09 PM ET Palo Alto PT Lifted; Fitbit Started At Market Perform 
Palo Alto Networks' (NYSE:PANW) price target was raised Thursday after a strong earnings report, while analysts grew bullish on affordable luxury firms Coach (NYSE:COH) and Signet Jewelers (NYSE:SIG). Stifel raised Palo Alto's price target to 200 from 180 a day after the cybersecurity firm reported ... 12:36 PM ET Signet Jewelers: Wearables May Be In Stores In 1H 2016 
Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) is refining its fashion sensibilities with the Wednesday debut of Apple Watch Hermes, a luxury designer collaboration with the maker of Birkin bags. But it is not the only one advancing on the stylish smartwatch space. Signet Jewelers (NYSE:SIG) CEO Mark Light told IBD that the ... 12:21 PM ET
